uneasy.translation[0].definitions[0].def: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen
uneasy.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
uneasy.translation[0].definitions[1].def: used to describe a period of time when people have agreed to stop fighting or arguing, but which is not really calm
uneasy.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The treaty restored an uneasy peace to the country.
uneasy.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
uneasy.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: â€“ Meaning 2: used to describe a period of time when people have agreed to stop fighting or arguing, but which is not really calm
uneasy.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: There was an uneasy peace in the region for nearly three years before the conflict flared up again.
It was an uneasy truce, however, and tension was never far from the surface.
Things seemed quiet enough, but it was an uneasy calm.
The government is based on an uneasy alliance between Christian Democrats and Socialists.
The result was an uneasy compromise which no-one liked.
